section.name: Using OpenEdge Maverick Framework
section.p:
As looking at examples is usually the best way of learning, we made two examples.
included in ${projecthome}/src/example is a simple example that shows you how to use OpenEdge Modules and OpenEdge Access with the Maverick framework. Note that this example has dependencies on two component implementations not included in this project: usermanager-hib and mailjob from openedge-modules-impl.
as a seperate project, maverickexample shows with a simple database editing web application (based on Hibernate and MySQL) how to use the default error handling etc.

subsection.name: Maverick Example
subsection.p:
you should take a good look at the classes in package: 'nl.openedge.maverick.example.ctrl' and the Velocity files 'listcds.vm', 'editcd.vm' and 'VM_global_library.vm'. The framework itself consist of the four classes in package 'nl.openedge.maverick.example'.
The main rules to use the framework are:
Controlls should override nl.openedge.maverick.framework.AbstractCtrl
Forms (used for request parameter passing) should override nl.openedge.maverick.framework.AbstractForm
To use the errorhandling, fields should have consistent naming. E.g:
<input type="text" name="cd.year" size="40" value="$!{cd.year}"> #error("cd.year")
Take a look at the methods in AbstractCtrl you can override. This can be usefull for customized error handling/ form populating. For an example look at EditCDSubmitCtrl.
